resources.string: Manage custom headers. Each of the headers you add will be added to every API request

To change the Hold temperature long press on the Grill Probe or select Hold mode again

Feature is only available in Hold and Smoke modes
Feature is only available in Hold mode

If your PiFire server requires authentication enter it here or continue if not required
Enter your PiFire server address. You should set this to be a static IP address or set it up to be a resolvable DNS address
Connection to your PiFire server is now complete. Name your grill below and continue to finish the setup process
PiFire has responded with an authentication error. Verify your credentials are correct and try again

This application will trust self signed certificates that are imported to Android credential storage. Please verify your certificate is imported or the application will fail to connect. If you are using a trusted certificate please check your server for other ssl issues
You will need to consent to the OneSignal data privacy later if you wish to have PiFire Android receive push notifications

The connection to PiFire failed. Check your connection and try again
PID, cycle, P-Mode, smoke plus, lid
Duration, temps, priming, smart start, power
Automatically select the first online smoker when opening app
If the application crashes this will send a report to the developer
Send crash reports to Sentry in debug build
Include your email address with the error report
Use basic authentication if PiFire is behind a reverse proxy

This app does not enforce a secure connection to PiFire and will send your credentials and/or headers regardless of the protocol being used (http or https). It is your responsibility to setup a secure connection (https) for all requests if you are using any type of authentication, otherwise your credentials and/or headers are being sent in an unsecure manner
Add custom headers to all requests for services like Cloudflare Access etc
Increment Grill and Probe Temps by 5°
When enabled the app colors are dynamically changed based on the users wallpaper etc
Dynamic Color feature requires Android 12 or newer (Api 31+)
Force the screen to remain on while viewing the dashboard.
Show or hide the bottom bar on the dashboard
Changing the scale/units will restart the grill controller (stopping any currently running modes) and automatically erase history.
Probe type does not use profiles

During Startup and Smoke modes, the cycle time (Auger On Time + Auger Off Time) is fixed, and does not change dynamically based on any other inputs. Effectively, this may allow you to adjust the rough smoke temperature depending other external factors like ambient temperature (seasonal), etc.

If a PMode of greater than zero is selected, the PMode is multiplied by 10s will be added to the Auger Off Time. [For example: Cycle Time = Auger On Time + Auger Off Time + (Pmode * 10)] This calculation is reflected in the table below. If you don\'t want to use PMode to configure the cycle time, then select a PMode of 0.
P-Mode is used for both Startup and Smoke modes, but not Hold mode. For more information about the P-Mode click here
Click here for a P-Mode chart

Smoke Plus Mode can be toggled on/off by tapping the smoke plus button on the dashboard. The button will be highlighted indicating that smoke plus is enabled. Smoke Plus will cycle the fan on and off during smoke and hold mode to promote additional smoke generation. Fan cycling will only occur between the above min/max temperatures.

Fan Ramping will ramp the fan from off to the desired duty cycle instead of just turning on to full speed during Smoke Plus cycling. You can control the ramp duration by setting the Fan ON Time below. The desired duty cycle can also be set below.

This is the temperature band centered around the set point, that the controller is active. If the error is less than PB/2, the command is 1.0. Higher PB\'s decrease controller response to error. [Default=60.0]
Time (in seconds) to predict the future value. Higher Td makes the controller more responsive to the Error Rate of Change. [Default=45.0]
Time (in seconds) to eliminate the integral error. Higher Ti makes the controller less responsive to accumulated error over time. [Default=180.0]
Window +/- from Set Point for triggering Overshoot condition. When in Overshoot, Output is set to min. [Default=12]

Center of Cycle Ratio, which is specific to the way this PID will behave. Higher Centers increase system response at high set points. Lower Centers increase system stability at low set points but may keep the system from reaching high set points. [Default=0.5]

Center Factor multiplied by Set Point. Higher Center Factors increase system response at high set points. Lower Center Factors increase system stability at low set points but may keep the system from reaching high set points. Controller accounts for F to C conversion. EX: At 240F(115C) center is 240 * 0.0012 = 0.288. [Default=0.0010]

Time constant for the Smith Predictor. This is the time it takes the system to reach 2/3 of it\'s final value after a Set Point change. Higher Tau decreases system sensitivity to model mismatch. [Default=115]

Time delay in the system. Theta is measured after commanding a Set Point change as the time it takes from the initial command to seeing initial temperature rise. Higher Theta makes the system more sensitive to delays in the system. [Default=65]
No configuration options are exposed for this controller

Amount of seconds for a complete cycle. At the beginning of each cycle, the controller will check the current temperature and set point to determine the cycle ratio (auger ON time / auger OFF time). [Default=25]
Minimum percentage of cycle where the auger is on. This is to prevent flame–out which can happen with a cycle ratio of less than 0.1. (0.0 – 0.99) [Default=0.1]
Maximum percentage of cycle where the auger is on. This is to minimize possible overshoots, or overcompensation in temperature. (0.0 – 1.0) [Default=0.9]

If enabled, the system will attempt to determine if the lid was opened and temporarily suspend the PID. If the temperature drops below the threshold (percentage of the hold temperature), a lid open event is triggered. Once lid open is detected, it will pause the PID for the specified amount of seconds.

The Keep Warm mode is a specified Hold temperature, that you can define, that can be activated by a timer or notification targets. When the grill is active, you can click on the timer dialog and check the Keep Warm box. Or you can click on the Notification Targets for any of the probes and select the Keep Warm box. The Keep Warm function will be activated when a probe notify target has been achieved or the timer has expired. The Grill will exit the currently running mode and switch to Hold Mode then attempt to maintain the temperature set above.
Amount of time for startup before transitioning to smoke or attempting a reignite
Select what mode to transition to after initial startup. Default is Smoke Mode.

Smart Start will sample the temperature from your grill probe on startup to determine the best startup time and Smoke mode cycle settings. If this mode is enabled, it will override the startup and smoke cycle settings.
Set this value to 0 to disable this startup exit temperature
Amount of time fan will run after shutdown is selected
When enabled the Raspberry Pi will auto power off after the Grill Shutdown Mode has ended
Enables an additional check after clicking startup, to prevent accidental startup
Allows overrides to outputs during operation

Allow the ability to manually control outputs like the igniter, fan and auger, during normal operation. Keep in mind that during normal operation the igniter, fan and auger may (or may not) be controlled by the controller and user changes may be overridden. Use the above override time to block the controller from making changes for a period of seconds.

In an error condition (temp too low, temp too high) the grill will immediately shutdown and log the error in the events log. Notifications of an error will be sent if enabled. The Max Temp safety setting is also enabled in Monitor mode.

Safety features are not infallible and may not prevent safety issues with your grill in all cases. As with any grill, it is the operator\'s responsibility to monitor their equipment to ensure proper operational safety.
Add commas for multiple user keys. Leave blank to disable.

Enter a unique name for this instance of PiFire. This name is used as the root mqtt topic for this device. Changing it later will result in new mqtt topics being created, and if using Home Assistant will result in new sensors being created.
Enter the IP or host name of your mqtt broker and port. ex:homeassistant.local 1883
Leave the username and password blank if your broker does not require authentication
Specify in seconds, how often you would like to publish PiFire data to the mqtt broker.
The Home Assistant MQTT integration. can automatically add PiFire and its devices if you specify the discovery topic name here

OneSignal is used to deliver notifications from PiFire. No Personally Identifiable Information is being collected by OneSignal. Notification data sent through OneSignal\'s API will be deleted after ~30 days.
Once you accept, this device will register with OneSignal. Consent can be revoked to prevent further communication with OneSignal.
OneSignal.com must not be blocked (e.g. in PiHole) for device registration to succeed
To receive notifications from PiFire consent to the OneSignal data privacy.
This device has not registered with OneSignal servers. Verify OneSignal.com is not blocked (e.g. PiHole) The registration process can take up to 2 minutes.
This device will attempt to register with your PiFire server now. This process can take a couple minutes.
There was an unexpected error with OneSignal. Please try again later.
OneSignal cannot obtain a push token from Google. If this device does not have Google Play Services installed push notifications will not be available
This device is not subscribed to OneSignal servers. Verify notifications for this app are not disabled in device settings. If notifications are not disabled the device will now attempt to subscribe
This mode enables server verbose debug logging. May impact performance
Allows manual control of the Auger, Fan, Igniter and Power outputs
If enabled this will cancel the current mode
Are you sure that you want to permanently delete the history log? This operation cannot be undone.
Are you sure that you want to permanently delete the events log? This operation cannot be undone.
Are you sure that you want to permanently delete the pellets log? This operation cannot be undone.
Are you sure that you want to permanently delete the pellets database? This operation cannot be undone.
Remove all user settings and restore to default
Are you sure that you want to reset to factory defaults? This operation cannot be undone.
Are you sure that you want to restart the control script
Are you sure that you want to restart the webapp script
Are you sure that you want to restart supervisor
Are you sure that you want to reboot the system
Are you sure that you want to shutdown the system
Pellet levels below the warning threshold will receive notifications during a cook at the specified check time intervals
The distance value for full must be smaller than the value for empty.

This value is used to calculate how long to run the auger when priming, and to calculate estimated pellet usage. This value can be tuned for your auger speed, by going into manual mode and running the auger for 10 seconds, then weighing the pellets that have been dispensed into the firepot. For example, if you run the auger for 10 seconds and 3 grams of pellets are dispensed, then the calculation would be 3g / 10s = 0.3. That means 0.3 grams are dispensed per second of auger on time.

Only enable the igniter during Priming, if you are absolutely sure that you need to do this. Enabling the igniter will ignite pellets and start the firepot, even without the fan enabled. This feature will only turn on the igniter if Prime & Startup is selected. Otherwise, priming without startup will not utilize the igniter.
If enabled Temp Fan Control will override Smoke Plus fan ramping. The fan will adjust with temperature and still cycle on and off but will not ramp up to speed.

If Current Grill Temp is over Set Temp Fan will be set to Minimum Duty Cycle. If the Grill temp is below the Set Temp the Duty Cycles below will be used. Example: If Current Grill Temp drops below Set Temp by 1–3 ° a 20% PWM will be set. If the Grill Temp drops below the Set Temp by 15° a 75% Duty Cycle will be set.
Note: Enter a value in the range %1$s-%2$s%3$s
Note: Enter a value greater than %1$s%2$s
Note: Temp cannot be changed for the last profile

It looks like you are attempting to use an authentication method but are using an unsecure protocol (http). If you continue your credentials will not be sent in a secure manner. Continue at your own risk or setup a secure connection to your PiFire server
Your current PiFire version is unsupported please update PiFire to the minimum version of %1$s build %2$s \n\nYour current version is %3$s build %4$s
